result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christina R. Szitta

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christina R. Maddix in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 16CF173, 16CF237, 16CM29 & 16CM257 @ 9:55 am.  Correct legal name is Szitta.  16CF173 Court amends Caption to Christine R. Szitta. State and Atty trying to keep all cases moving.  Recess @ 9:58 am. Reconvene @ 10:19 am  16CF173 ct 3 Dismissed, ct 1 & 2 plea, 16CM29 DRI, $300 Restitution on that case 16CM237 Ct 1 DRI, ct 2 plea, 16CM257 plea to charge.  16CF237 35 days credit.  Sentence on all withheld sentence 2 years probation on each ct concurrent, no contact with N.B., $300 Rest on 16CM29, costs, DNA sample, AODA and follow through and Counseling deemed by agent. Victim rights have been complied with.  Credit on 16CF173 may have credit but would like 30 days to figure amount.  9 days credit on 16CF173.  Abernethy-Mays and defendant agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF173 Ct 1 Maintain Drg Trafficking Place, 2nd offense, No contest plea, Ct 2 Poss Drg Parph to Mnf, 2nd offense, no contest, 16CF237 Ct 2 Retail Theft, no contest, 16CM257 Theft, no contest plea 16CF173 DRI ct 3, DRI 16CF237 Ct 1, 16CM29 DRI and Restitution figure.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior conviction. Atty Abernethy-Mays is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty in 16CF173 Ct 1 Maintain Drg Trafficking Place, 2nd offense, Ct 2 Poss Meth Drg Parph to Mnf, 2nd offense, 16CF237 Ct 2 Retail Theft, 16CM257 Theft. State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Abernethy-Mays gives sentencing recommendation. Def. has nothing to say.  Court is going to modified sentence a little.  Court orders on 

16CF173 ct 1 withheld sentence 2 years probation, Same conditions on all probation case No Contact with N.B., Rest $300, AODA deemed by agent, 9 days credit, 250 DNA surcharge and sample, costs, Bond applied
ct 2 6 years prison, impose and stayed 2 years probation, 3 years initial confinement 3 years extended supervision Same conditions on ct 1 250 DNA surcharge, 9 day credit if revoked, costs, 
16CF237 ct 2 withheld sentence 2 years probation Same conditions, all sentence are concurrent, 200 DNA surcharge, costs, 35 days credit if revoked
16CM257 withheld sentence 2 years probation, Same conditions, costs, $200 DNA Surcharge. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court read victim impact statement. Def. is eligible for Challenge & Substance Programs.

Defendant Christina R. Szitta in court by video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:16 p.m. Arrested on warrant for failure to appear on 9/23/16. Def explains why didn't appear. State asks Court to reinstate bond. Court vacates warrant and reinstates previous signature bond.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:52 a.m. Scheduled for plea/sentencing @ 9:30 a.m. Atty Abernethy-Mays has not had contact. Makes statement regarding possible misunderstanding by Defendant. State requests body only warrant. Court authorizes body or $500 warrant, adjacent counties.

Defendant Christina R. Szitta in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, and waive reading.  Penalties reviewed.  Not guilty plea entered.  Reserve jurisdictional objections.  Court will receive not guitly pleas.  Bond will continued  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christina R. Szitta
Current: 113 Morse St, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 02-29-2016)
Prior: 1018  Clermont Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant Christina R. Szitta in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:00 pm.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights & given options. Def. would like to get an atty. State gives bond recommendations. Court orders $500.00 Signauture bond w/condition.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
